chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas Anthony Manley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Shall receive 2 days presentence credit if supervison should be revoked

miscConds.notes: Must obtain/maintain full-time employment upon release
Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

timeConds.notes: Concurrent with: with work release and transfer privileges

records.addlTxt: Defendant Thomas Anthony Manley in court, in custody with attorney Greg E. Vollan.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    The Court reviewed CPR and PQWOR and heard plea of No Contest to OMVWOC, Ct. found plea was given FKVI, accepted plea, and found Def guilty of the charge. Court found factual basis in the Crim. Compl./Info. The State is in compliance with Victims Rights.  No request for restitution from the victim in this case.  The Court heard from State, Defense and Defendant, and sentenced him as follows:  S/W, 3 yrs with terms; Ab. Sob.; AODA/followthru as req. agent; full time employment upon his release; court costs; 120 days concurrent to his present sentence-with H/T.  2 days of presentence credit upon revocation.
Status conference on February 10, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Thomas Anthony Manley in court, in custody with attorney Greg E. Vollan.  Kurt Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions and waiver of prelim is done on the record; discussion held; defendant waives prelim; Court accepts waiver and reviews information with defendant; Court grants 7 days for sub of judge request to be filed; no guilty plea is entered;  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for January 27, 2015 at 11:45 am.
Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim TDE or his residence.

12:46 - Defendant Thomas Anthony Manley in court, in custody via video with attorney Greg E. Vollan (eligible).  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested waiving time limits. Prelim set. Court sets bond at $1000 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with TDE dob 8/13/76 and his residence.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
